text: 1.4 million new cases; 106,000 hospitalizations; 15,966 deaths. Even in a horrible year, this week stands out, writes @COVID19tracking. https://t.co/vrtVDtiEFX

name: TheAtlantic
text:

As @edyong209 writes, COVID-19 intensified both.

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Today the Electoral College will cast its official votes for president.

The institution has been a point of controversy for years. Abolishing it may be impossible, but in future years there could be a way around it, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/1qZgUSX2XX

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @elainejgodfrey: I've gotten a lot of emails in response to this story, but one has stuck out: A man wrote to ask if I'd seen his father in the ICU while I was reporting. His father later died. "Do you recall him?" he asked. I don't think I'll ever forget that question.

https://t.co/wyNIraQhz1

name: TheAtlantic
text:
1/ When the coronavirus hit, thousands of researchers dropped their previous work and began working on a solution to the pandemic instead.
